page.title: 04Inside the home.
page.content:
Part of our Domesday Survey asked the parents of children in our school which of a number of consumer items they owned. Every one of the surveyed families had a{television,}almost all (96%) had a{telephone,}89% had{central {heating,}81% a{freezer}and over half (54% and 53% respectively) a{video}and a{computer.
In comparison, patterns of ownership were very different when these parents were children themselves. Even then, though, most families (93%) owned a television. However none had a video or a computer. 26% had a telephone and less than 18% either a freezer or central heating.
{Times,}it would seem,{have changed.
